title: Shaw v Reno and Majority Minority Districts

content.question: Which of the following was the ruling in Shaw v. Reno (1993) ?

choices.label: Creating districts where a minority is the majority does not violate the Ninth Amendment.
Racial gerrymandering can violate the Fourteenth Amendment unless it achieves a compelling state interest.
Districts must be equal in population size because of the Fourteenth Amendment.
Districts drawn in unusual shapes or sizes violate the Ninth Amendment.

content.answer: Racial gerrymandering can violate the Fourteenth Amendment unless it achieves a compelling state interest.
